entry.title: Best Way to Store Password in Database
TensorFlow vs SciKit Learn
entry.content:
• TensorFlow is more low-level;
  • Scikit-learn offers you off-the-shelf algorithms, e.g., algorithms for classification such as SVMs, Random Forests, Logistic Regression
  • Scikit-learn does not support GPU at this time. http://scikit-learn.org/stable/faq.html#will-you-add-gpu-support
  • Skflow: Simplified interface for TensorFlow (mimicking Scikit Learn) for Deep Learning. SkFlow has been moved to Tensorflow. https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/contrib/learn/python/learn

ref: https://www.quora.com/What-are-the-main-differences-between-TensorFlow-and-SciKit-Learn

entry.title: Http Clients in Java
entry.content:
recommended, because they are easy to use and powerful spring resttemplate http://unirest.io/java.html

not recommended, because they use low level api http://hc.apache.org/httpcomponents-client-ga/index.html http://hc.apache.org/httpclient-3.x/

entry.title: Why React.js Is So Cool?
entry.content:
React.js makes things simple. and it wins others js framework by concept Re-render is automatic in Reack.js . So we can think more OOP when using it.

I think the only problme is: Some DOM code is inside the javascript code. This make the code hard to read and rewrite.
